byline.contributor: An employee of The New York Times contributed reporting from Salahuddin Province, and Helene Cooper from Washington.
byline.original: By ROD NORDLAND and OMAR AL-JAWOSHY

abstract: Iraqi leaders issue assurances that Shiite militias will cooperate with United States in effort to retake Tikrit from Islamic State militants, despite several mobilization committees, as militias are known, having quit offensive in protest of American airstrikes.
lead_paragraph: A message of support from Grand Ayatollah Ali al-Sistani, a religious leader in Iraq, apparently has the militias cooperating with the role of the United States.

headline.main: Shiite Militias in Iraq Back Off Boycott Over U.S. Strikes on ISIS
headline.print_headline: Iraqi Leader Says Forces Will Aid U.S. in ISIS Fight

snippet: A message of support from Grand Ayatollah Ali al-Sistani, a religious leader in Iraq, apparently has the militias cooperating with the role of the United States.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
